name: Lemon drizzle cake
description: It's difficult not to demolish this classic by Tana Ramsay in just one sitting, so why not make two at once?...

name: Croquembouche
description: This is a little cheffy, but I wanted to show that anyone can make one. I used to find it tricky, but then I found this method. I love it with dulce de leche, but strawberries with cream are fab. Whatever floats your bateau.

name: Mediterranean 'chicken 'n' chips'
description: Lovely lemony chicken legs with crushed new potatoes, all cooked in one tray – it’s such an easy, satisfying dinner and the zingy, herby flavours will bring a bit of sunshine to the table.

name: Roast carrot & fennel soup
description: A sweet and aromatic soup with super-easy flatbreads for dunking

name: Beef Wellington
source: Ultimate Cookery Course by Hodder & Stoughton
description: You can dress up a beef Wellington with foie gras, cep mushrooms, or even truffles, but in my opinion, that beautiful fillet of beef should always be the star

name: Classic guacamole
description: Super-quick and easy, this tasty guacamole recipe takes just 10 minutes to knock together

name: Jamie's beautiful bruschetta
description: As long as you've got bread and a topping that takes your fancy, rustling up bruschetta is easy

name: Limoncello
description: This recipe needs good quality Amalfi lemons, and 95% pure grain alcohol (although you must never drink this neat). The alcohol isn’t easily available in the UK, but it is sold in most grocery stores across Europe and is available from gerrys.uk.com.

name: Berry & rosemary juniper gin fizz
description: This zippy herbaceous cocktail is a welcome change from rich festive drinks
